name: Breaking Release

2. Dropping python 2 and python 3.3, 3.4, 3.5 support. Only support Python 3.6 +
3. delivers #74,   #86

name: Performan boost for python2
body: release long waited #19 because pyexcel-ezodf now replaces ezodf. https://github.com/pyexcel/pyexcel-ezodf/commit/f6a5fcc5b458835b6b930f019dc7e0c385ee8146

name: Maintenance release
body: fix #42

name: Walk away gracefully when mmap is not available
Plugin interface update with lml
body:
# major impact
On the users who uses pyinstaller as you will need to include a log hidden imports, please see [the documentation for instructions](http://pyexcel-io.readthedocs.io/en/latest/pyinstaller.html)

# new

1. iget_data function is introduced and the developer needs to close the file handler later
2. individual Reader and Writer Class interface now support 'with' context manager.


# updated

the plugin interface now uses [lml](http://lml.readthedocs.io).

2. Please try it and give me your feedback.

name: Maintenance release
body: bug fix #4 and propagate the same fix to its plugins that uses base:to_array(), at least it helps https://github.com/chfw/pyexcel-xlsx/issues/1

name: Maintenance release
body: Better error handling in case of #3

name: Support for pyramid-excel
body: pyramid use zope.alchemy and transaction which will do commit after each handler and does not want custom library to do database commit. hence, I am provide the option to disable commit if requested for sqlbook.py

name: Bug fixes
body:
1. Bug fixes in django and sqlalchemy side: #1
2. Bug fix in django side only: #2 
3. Pass on file type to reader and writers, due to pyexcel-text had one writer across many file types.

name: Indepence from pyexcel
body:
-    handle the delegate file interface to access various excel file formats
-    support read and write access to csv, csvz, django models and sqlalchemy tables
-    empower pyexcel-xls, pyexcel-xlsx, pyexcel-ods(3) as standalone library to read and write more formats

name: Optimization for loading single sheet from a multiple book
body:
- Loads only one sheet from a multiple sheet book
- Use New BSD License

name: Abstraction - Prevent developer from providing incomplete functions
body:
- Programmatically guide pyexcel extension developers on what methods should have been implemented.
  - It wont allow you to instantiate from you custom class unless you implement all abstract methods
- Passing custom keywords to your classes
- Providing NamedContent as a helper class for data content that does not have a name but a name(sheet name) is required when writing a pyexcel extension.

name: initial release
body:
- the implementation of this package can be a plugin to pyexcel
- And can also be an indenpendent read/write library for any file format in mind
